name: RD for Google
description: Hope you enjoy this very very very unfinished style

additional_info:
V.1
Initial release

v.1.1
-Rainbow Buttons added
-removed some useless bars

V.2
-An update so freaking huge it governed a second version.
-Fixed buttons
-Colored more buttons
-Colored Text
-No more background on pictures page
-Colored links
I usually come on stylish rarely, and only to check how my styles have been doing. 45 minutes ago I looked at this style and saw that it was at 106 downloads. That's unbelievable! (Well for me anyway) So, since this style was pretty much just a re-skin of the Google background, (and a mediocre one at that) I decided it was time to really get down to business. I sat down and spent 45 minutes making everything so very pretty, and now that I know I have a reasonably large audience, you can assure yourself that there are many updates to come. Again, thank you so much for the 106 downloads!

V.2.1
-Edited the buttons on the about:newtab screen of Google Chrome
Those 8 buttons on the about:newtab screen that shows the 8 most visited websites on your computer now have a 3 point gradient, the top 2 are transparent and the bottom one is Rainbow Dash's coat color. If you enjoy, I would appreciate if you could do me a favor and point out all the flaws in my code in the discussion area, or PM me (I'm not being sarcastic, I'm still very much a noob at HTML code so I'm sure there are a lot of flaws I haven't yet seen, so if you see them, please do not hesitate to tell me so I can fix them immediately. Thanks)If you have any tips for me on how to edit "Element.Style" a little bit easier, again, do not hesitate to tell me, my code could be much better by knowing the tricks to element.style.

V.2.1.1
-Firefox catering
-Text color changing
-Box color changing
When doing the about:newtab stuff with Chrome, I realized that Firefox has to have something similar. I never really use Firefox, so since I was showing too much of a Bias towards Chrome with the last update, I now catered to Firefox a little bit. The about:newtab on Firefox now has the RD background, as well as RD's coat color as the bars at the bottom of the links to the most visited websites, and her eye color as the text.

V.2.1.2
-Small fixes
Fixed the Google logo appearing randomly.
